intro: Anguloa × ruckeri var. media, commonly known as the hybrid anguloa, is a species of flowering plant in the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. This plant is characterized by its vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in a range of colors including pink, red, and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists.
